channel.title: probabilities on Laurent Parenteau
channel.description: Recent content in probabilities on Laurent Parenteau

item.title: Exponential Growth: Myth, Reality, and Strategic Considerations
item.description: While exponential growth demonstrates immense potential, it is crucial to realistically assess growth rates, sustainability, and timeframes to avoid overestimating outcomes and sometimes consider high-risk strategies instead.

item.title: Decoding Success and Failure: A Rational Approach
item.description: In software engineering, recognizing the roles of both skill and luck through probabilistic thinking, as proposed by Annie Duke, can lead to better decision-making and constructive self-reflection.

item.title: Embracing the Grey: A Probabilistic Approach to Engineering Decision-Making
item.description: Adopting Annie Duke’s ‘thinking in bets’ framework in software engineering emphasizes making decisions based on a probabilistic perspective, acknowledging the roles of skill and luck, and fostering a continuous improvement mindset to navigate the inherent uncertainties of the field.
